page.title: 02Housing in Horsmonden
page.content: There is one Council estate in Horsmonden which is Gibbet Lane and Orchard Close , built in the 1940s. The Orchard estate is mainly three and four bedroomed detached, owner-occupied houses built in the early 1960s. However at the West end of Orchard Crescent there are some Council houses & flats. Fromandez Drive and Angley Court are estates of privately-owned, detached or semi-detached bungalows. There are terraces of four small houses in Maidstone Road, Goudhurst Road and Lamberhurst Road. Practically every home in Horsmonden has a garden, some of them very large. Many people grow their own vegetables like runner- beans, carrots, potatoes and salad crops. Homes are heated by electricity, oil or solid fuel. There is no gas in Horsmonden except calor gas.
